abstract: Self-described socialist Bernie Sanders is seen by many as wildly idealistic, but his actions and accomplishments as mayor of Burlington, VT, in 1980s indicate high degree of pragmatism; achieved goals of revitalizing city while stemming gentrification by prioritizing immediate needs of community and collaborating across ideological lines.
lead_paragraph: Bernie Sanders, who in the 1980s was mayor of Vermont’s largest city, Burlington, tended to talk globally but act locally, aligning with Republicans to get things done.

headline.main: As Mayor, Bernie Sanders Was More Pragmatist Than Socialist
headline.print_headline: As a Mayor, Sanders Favored Pragmatism Over His Idealism
